Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
CAN: The student can draw a basic representation of a fish within a water environment like a lake or a river. (shows water with fish in it)
The student can include simple elements of the habitat like water and possibly one plant or seaweed. (basic labeling present)
CANNOT: The student is likely unable to consistently or accurately label all necessary survival components such as specific water/clouds, food, and other fish. (labels may be missing or incorrect)
The student may not clearly show relationships between the fish and its habitat, like why the fish needs water to survive. (lack of connection shown between fish and habitat elements)
The student may incorrectly label the habitat components, or miss connecting them as part of a larger system the fish depends on. (misunderstands how each part of the habitat supports the fish)
